none: Northwestern vs. Minnesota and Northwestern vs. Purdue
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music
Bagley, E. E. National emblem march
Gershwin, George, 1898-1937. Strike up the band
Williams, John, 1932- Olympic fanfare and theme
Hayes, Isaac. Shaft. Theme from Shaft

Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1984 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Minnesota Gophers in Minneapolis, Minnesota. The halftime performance theme was a salute to heroes and included the "1984 Olympic Fanfare" and the "Theme to Shaft." The University of Minnesota Marching Band halftime performance includes "Theme from Shaft" and "Latina." After the Minnesota Homecoming Court is announced, "Hail Minnesota" is performed. Postgame performances by both bands include "Go U Northwestern," "Minnesota Rouser," "California Dreaming," "Ghostbusters," "Theme from Shaft," and "Alma Mater." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Purdue Boilermakers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums from 1930-1985 begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Dale Lonis, performs the National Anthem, "Hail Purdue" "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." Composer Sheldon Harnick served as Grand Marshal for the homecoming game. Halftime performances include Harnick's "I Can't Stand Dragons," which was arranged by John P. Paynter. "On Broadway" and "National Emblem" were also performed. The NUMB alums join the marching band for "Strike Up the Band." John P. Paynter then conducts Alma Mater. Postgame performances by the NU Marching Band include "Go U Northwestern," "When the Saints Go Marching In," "Fame," "Bill Bailey Won't You Please Come Home," and "Alma Mater."

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
